column4: Hello, I installed ubuntu on my Alienware Area-51m laptop a few days ago and it keeps freezing up... So I tried ubuntu studio on it and I'm still having the os freezing, any ideas?
pastebin /var/log/messages and lshw
open a terminal, type lshw, copy and paste all output to the paste page
pastebin the output of lshw
as text not an image
lshw | pastebinit -
use the command i've just type
sudo pastebinit /var/log/messages
http://pastebin.com/Vxsr7zsw
here's the pastebin http://pastebin.com/Vxsr7zsw
i'm looking into it
i can't put my finger on anything in particular, but i suspect nouveau is the culprit, have you install the blob nvidia driver?
i havent installed any drivers yet. I thought thats what the problem was when i had regular ubuntu installed
well try the closed driver and see
system > administration > hardware drivers
https://help.ubuntu.com/community/BinaryDriverHowto/Nvidia has many tips if something went wrong
i cant get to the desktop... it will freeze before i can do anything, that is if i can actually make it to the desktop before the freeze beats me to it :P
im in recovery mode right now... only way i can run these commands, lol
well then follow the commands in the 'common issues' section
i updated the nvidia driver and now it's asking me to login as root... the ubuntu studio installer nerver asked me to setup a root password
what's asking you to login as root?
now it boots into "atudiolt login: _"
